availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Presley (Hopkins and Webster County, Kentucky, )

body.p: Hopkins and Webster County, Kentucky, laborer and farm laborer. South Carolina native. Married to Mahala Barger Presley in Greene County, Tennessee, on March 17, 1821. Father of Henry Presley, William R. Presley, David Presley, John Presley, and George Presley. Married to Catharine Carter Presley in Webster County, Kentucky, on March 21, 1865. Laborer in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farm laborer in Webster County in 1860. Household owned four enslaved persons in Webster County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District No. 2, p. 157A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, 607.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 485B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Webster County Marriages, Film #000568132.
Tennessee State Marriages, 1780-2002, Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, TN, Greene County Marriages, May 1780-September 1836.
